page.title: 16ST. MARY'S WOOLPIT 1
page.content: There has been a church here since Saxon times. In 1182 Abbot Samson(St.Edmondsbury Abbey) went to Rome to ask Alexander III to restore the church to the abbey.He must have been successful because in 1183 he appointed the brother of his companion to Italy as the Vicar of the church at "Wlpet". In the 15th.Century the shrine of "Our Lady of Wulpit" was visited by pilgrims from all over the country. Queen Elizabeth I.is supposed to have visited the church and given the lectern. In 1702 the spire was blown down in a gale and rebuilt in 1708 but was struck by lightening and destroyed again in 1852.During the reconstruction Norman remains were found.
